column4: can you tell an interface to be promiscuous in the /etc/network/interface file?
ha ha ha... no as in listen to everything.
You have the wrong locale set
Then your clock is wrong?  IDK haha
Knowing linux the human race is probably wrong about the time.
some very strange here.... the 'date' command has it correct... the time shown by the calendar program has it wrong.
mmm.  I'm not sure.  Never dug into all that before
Change the time in the calendar app?
I think I know what it is... I haven't logged out since before the change... and the calendar hasn't noticed that the time change occured while it has been running...
log out and log back in?
now its showing the correct time... this seems wrong to me.
That you logged out / in?  Or that you changed it manually?

I couldn't change it manually without affect the time remembered by the computer... but needing to log out/in to get the calendar correct, after a daylight saving change doesn't seem like a bug to me.
It doesn't seem like a bug?  I think the opposite.  You should file a bug on launchpad
